文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk1
证据片段: Out-of-pile experiments have been performed to investigate the escalation in temperature of Zircaloy-clad fuel rods during heatup in steam due to the exothermal Zircaloy steam reaction.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk1
证据片段: The initial heating rates were varied from 0.3 to 2.5 K/s.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk1
证据片段: The maximum measured surface temperature was about 2200°C.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk1
证据片段: Damage to the fuel rods increased with increasing heatup rate.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk1
证据片段: The oxidation of zirconium in steam is an exothermal reaction, which may be written as Zr + 2H₂O → ZrO₂ + 2H₂ + 140 Kcal/mole

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk1
证据片段: In the energy balance 255 Kcal/mole are gained by the uptake of oxygen and 115 Kcal/mole are lost by the dissociation of two moles water.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk1
证据片段: This energy is sufficient to heat the fuel rod (Zircaloy and uranium dioxide [UO₂]) to about 3700°C including melting of both materials and neglecting any heat loss.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk1
证据片段: The zirconium oxide layer formed acts as a barrier to further oxidation.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk1
证据片段: The fuel rod simulators had lengths of 25 cm (ESSI-1 to ESSI-3) and 37 cm (ESSI-4 to ESSI-11).

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk1
证据片段: The central tungsten heater had a diameter of 6 mm

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk1
证据片段: the annular UO₂ pellet had an inner diameter of 6.1 mm and an outer diameter of 9.2 mm

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk1
证据片段: The Zircaloy cladding had the original pressurized water reactor (PWR) dimensions of 9.29-mm inner and 10.75-mm outer diameter.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk2
证据片段: The maximum temperature of the shroud was around $1 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ lower

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk2
证据片段: heat of reaction (140 Kcal/mole zirconium)

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk2
证据片段: Cathcart data are verified only up to $1 5 5 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk3
证据片段: the maximum oxygen absorption was determined to be $2 { \mathrm { ~ m g / c m } } ^ { 2 } \leq$ in the rod

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk3
证据片段: $3 { \mathrm { ~ m g / c m } } ^ { 2 } { \mathrm { ~ s ~ } }$ in the shroud

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk3
证据片段: steam input of $3 2 \mathrm { \ g / m i n }$

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk3
证据片段: the thickness of the oxide layer was between 0.1 and $0 . 2 \mathrm { m m }$

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk3
证据片段: The temperature at which the escalation began increased from ESSI-7 (below $1 2 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C } \ ,$ to ESSI-4 (around $1 6 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C } )$

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk3
证据片段: temperatures of 3300 and $2 6 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ were found for fast $( 4 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C } / \mathsf { s } )$ and slow $( \mathbf { 0 . 5 ^ { \circ } C / s } )$ heatup rates, respectively

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk4
证据片段: According to the ternary phase diagram at $2 0 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk4
证据片段: ESSI-4 had a power input higher by the factor of 1.5 and a higher temperature by about $1 5 0 \mathrm { { \circ } } _ { \mathrm { { C } } }$

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk5
证据片段: In all tests a temperature escalation due to Zircaloy steam reaction was observed.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk5
证据片段: For fast initial heatup runoff of molten Zircaloy is a limiting process for the escalation.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk5
证据片段: In these tests, with 120° steam entering at the lower end, the escalation started in the upper region and moved towards the lower end.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk5
证据片段: For slow heatup rates nearly no interaction between the oxidized cladding and the UO2 was observed.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk5
证据片段: Nuclear reactor-type tube sections of both materials were exposed on both sides to superheated steam at temperatures ranging from 600 to 1300°C for up to 6 h.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_052_chunk5
证据片段: The specimens were evaluated by gravimetry, metallography, and other methods.
